question: What treasure did the man find hidden in a field?
explanation: Jesus simply calls it 'treasure' without specifying what it was; the kingdom of heaven is like this treasure.

verses.kjv: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

question: What separated the rich man from Lazarus in the afterlife?
explanation: And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been set in place, so that those who want to go from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.

verses.kjv:
And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that
would come from thence.

question: What happened to the guest without wedding clothes?
choices: He was thrown out into darkness
explanation: Then the king told the attendants, 'Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

verses.kjv:
Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast
him into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

question: In the parable of the shrewd manager, what did the manager do when he was about to be fired?
explanation: The manager called in his master's debtors and reduced their bills so they would take care of him after he lost his job.

verses.kjv:
So he called every one of his lord’s debtors
unto him,
 and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

question: In the parable of the persistent widow, what was she seeking from the judge?
explanation: And there was a widow in that town who kept coming to him with the plea, 'Grant me justice against my adversary.'

verses.kjv: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

question: In the parable of the rich fool, what did the man plan to do with his abundant crops?
explanation: Then he said, 'This is what I'll do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store my surplus grain.'

verses.kjv: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.

question: In the parable of the vineyard workers, when did the last workers start working?
explanation: About five in the afternoon (the eleventh hour) he went out and found still others standing around.

verses.kjv: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?

question: What did the unmerciful servant owe his master in the parable?
explanation: As he began the settlement, a man who owed him ten thousand bags of gold was brought to him.

verses.kjv: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.

question: In the parable of the sower, what does the seed that fell among thorns represent?
choices: Those choked by cares and riches
explanation: Jesus explained that the thorns represent cares, riches, and pleasures of life that choke the word and prevent fruitfulness.

verses.kjv: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

question: In the parable of the ten virgins, how many were wise and how many were foolish?
explanation: Five virgins were wise and brought extra oil, while five were foolish and brought no extra oil for their lamps.

verses.kjv: And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

question: What did the foolish virgins lack that prevented them from entering the wedding?
explanation: The foolish virgins took their lamps but took no oil with them, leaving them unprepared when the bridegroom arrived.

verses.kjv: They that were foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:

question: What did the servant with one talent do with it in Jesus' parable?
explanation: The fearful servant hid his lord's money in the earth rather than investing it.

verses.kjv: And I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, there thou hast that is thine.

question: In the parable of the two sons, which son ultimately did the father's will?
choices: The first who said no but later went
The second who said yes but didn't go
explanation: The first son initially refused but repented and went to work in the vineyard, doing his father's will.

verses.kjv: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.

question: How much did the good Samaritan pay the innkeeper to care for the wounded man?
explanation: The Samaritan gave the innkeeper two pence and promised to repay any additional expenses.

verses.kjv: And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gave them to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.

question: In the parable of the lost sheep, how many sheep did the shepherd leave to find the lost one?
explanation: The shepherd left ninety-nine sheep in the wilderness to search for the one that was lost.

verses.kjv: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?

question: In the parable of the prodigal son, what job did the younger son take in the far country?
explanation: After wasting his inheritance, the prodigal son was reduced to feeding pigs, an unclean occupation for a Jew.

verses.kjv: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.

question: What food did the prodigal son desire to eat while feeding the swine?
explanation: The son was so hungry he would have filled his belly with the husks the pigs were eating.

verses.kjv: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

question: What did the father give the prodigal son when he returned home?
explanation: The father ordered servants to bring the best robe, a ring for his hand, and shoes for his feet.

verses.kjv: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:

question: In the parable of the Pharisee and the publican, where did they go to pray?
explanation: Two men went up into the temple to pray; one a Pharisee and the other a publican.

verses.kjv: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

question: In the parable of the mustard seed, what does the seed grow into?
choices: A great tree with birds lodging in branches
explanation: Though the smallest of seeds, it grows into the greatest among herbs and becomes a tree.

verses.kjv: Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.

question: In the parable of the leaven, how much meal did the woman hide the leaven in?
explanation: The woman hid leaven in three measures of meal until the whole was leavened.

verses.kjv: Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

question: In the parable of the wheat and tares, who sowed the tares?
explanation: While men slept, the enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat.

verses.kjv: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

question: What did the householder command regarding the tares until harvest?
explanation: The master said to let both grow together until harvest to avoid uprooting the wheat.

verses.kjv: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.

question: In the parable of the dragnet, what was cast into the sea?
choices: A net that gathered every kind
explanation: The kingdom of heaven is likened to a net cast into the sea that gathered fish of every kind.

verses.kjv: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:

question: What happened to the bad fish in the parable of the dragnet?
explanation: The fishermen gathered the good into vessels but cast the bad away.

verses.kjv: Which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.

question: How much did the merchant sell to buy the pearl of great price?
explanation: When he found one pearl of great price, he sold all he had to buy it.

verses.kjv: Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

question: In the Sermon on the Mount, what reward do those who mourn receive?
explanation: Jesus promised that those who mourn are blessed because they shall be comforted.

verses.kjv: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

question: According to Jesus, what are the meek promised to inherit?
explanation: Jesus taught that the meek are blessed because they shall inherit the earth.

verses.kjv: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

question: In Jesus' teaching, what should you do if someone smites you on the right cheek?
explanation: Jesus taught to resist not evil and to turn the other cheek when struck.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

question: What did Jesus say not to let your left hand know?
choices: What your right hand does in giving
explanation: Jesus taught that alms should be given secretly, not letting the left hand know what the right does.

verses.kjv: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

question: In Jesus' teaching on prayer, what did He say the heathen use?
explanation: Jesus warned against using vain repetitions as the heathen do, thinking they'll be heard for many words.

verses.kjv: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

question: According to Jesus, where moth and rust corrupt, where is that?
choices: Earth where treasures are laid up
explanation: Jesus warned against laying up treasures on earth where moth and rust corrupt and thieves break through.

verses.kjv: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:

question: What did Jesus say about serving two masters?
choices: You cannot serve God and mammon
You must choose the wiser one
explanation: Jesus taught that no man can serve two masters; you cannot serve God and mammon.

verses.kjv: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

question: In Jesus' teaching, what creatures neither sow nor reap yet are fed by God?
explanation: Jesus pointed to fowls of the air as examples of God's providential care.

verses.kjv: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?

question: According to Jesus, what gate leads to destruction?
explanation: Jesus taught that wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction.

verses.kjv: Enter ye in at the strait gate: for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat:

question: In Jesus' parable of the two builders, what did the wise man build his house upon?
explanation: The wise man who hears Jesus' sayings and does them is like one who built his house upon a rock.

verses.kjv: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:

question: What did the lord deliver the unforgiving servant to?
explanation: The wrathful lord delivered the unforgiving servant to the tormentors until he paid all that was due.

verses.kjv: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.

question: In the parable of the laborers, what wage did those who worked all day receive?
explanation: Those who worked from early morning received a penny, the same as those who came at the eleventh hour.

verses.kjv: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny. But when the first came, they supposed that they should have received more; and they likewise received every man a penny.

question: In the parable of the wicked husbandmen, what did they do to the son?
choices: Killed him to seize his inheritance
Cast him out of the vineyard
explanation: The husbandmen saw the son and said 'let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.'

verses.kjv: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance. And they caught him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew him.

question: What stone did Jesus say became the head of the corner?
explanation: Jesus quoted the psalm about the stone rejected by builders becoming the head of the corner.

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

question: In the parable of the great supper, what excuses did the invited guests give?
choices: Bought land, oxen, and married a wife
explanation: The invited guests excused themselves: one bought land, one bought oxen, one had married a wife.

verses.kjv: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.

question: In the Lord’s Prayer, what did Jesus teach to say regarding God's name?
choices: Blessed be thy name forever only
Make thy name known to Caesar
explanation: Matthew 6:9 includes the phrase "Hallowed be thy name" as part of how Jesus taught to pray.

verses.kjv:
After this manner therefore pray ye:
Our Father which art in heaven,
Hallowed be thy name.

question: In the Lord’s Prayer, what did Jesus teach to say regarding God's kingdom?
explanation: Matthew 6:10 says to pray, "Thy kingdom come."

verses.kjv: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.

question: In the Lord’s Prayer, what did Jesus teach to say regarding God's will?
choices: Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven
My will be done in earth
Thy will be done only in heaven
Thy will be done only in Jerusalem
explanation: Matthew 6:10 teaches praying that God's will would be done on earth as in heaven.

verses.kjv: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.

question: In Jesus’ teaching, to whom did He compare the man who hears His sayings and does them?
explanation: Matthew 7:24 says the one who hears and does Jesus' sayings is like a wise man.

verses.kjv: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:

question: In Jesus’ teaching, to whom did He compare the man who hears His sayings and does not do them?
explanation: Matthew 7:26 says the one who hears and does not do Jesus' sayings is like a foolish man.

verses.kjv: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which built his house upon the sand:

question: In Jesus’ explanation of the wheat and the tares, who did He say sowed the good seed?
explanation: Matthew 13:37 says, "He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man."

verses.kjv: He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;

question: In Jesus’ explanation of the wheat and the tares, what did He say the field is?
explanation: Matthew 13:38 says, "The field is the world."

verses.kjv: The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one;

question: In Jesus’ explanation of the wheat and the tares, who did He say sowed the tares?
explanation: Matthew 13:39 says the enemy that sowed the tares is the devil.

verses.kjv: The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.

question: In the parable Jesus spoke in Luke, what did the lord say to his servant after the servant returned from the field?
choices: Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me
Go and sit down to meat
Take thy rest, for thou hast done well
Call thy friends and rejoice in thy labour
explanation: Luke 17:8 records the lord telling the servant to prepare and serve him first, then eat afterward.

verses.kjv: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?
